耍.definition: to play with; to wield; to act (cool etc); to display (a skill, one's temper etc)

耍嘴皮.definition: to show off with clever talk; big-headed; a smart-ass

耍嘴皮子.definition: to talk glibly; to talk big; to be all talk

耍寶.definition: to show off; to put on a show to amuse others

耍小聰明.definition: to get smart; to resort to petty tricks

耍廢.definition: (Tw) (slang) to pass time idly; to chill; to hang out

耍弄.definition: to play with; to engage in; to resort to; to dally with

耍滑.definition: to resort to tricks; to act in a slippery way; to try to evade (work, responsibility)

耍無賴.definition: to act shamelessly; to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval

耍猴.definition: to get a monkey to perform tricks; to put on a monkey show; to make fun of sb; to tease

耍私情.definition: the play of passions; carried away by passion (e.g. to commit a crime)

耍筆桿.definition: to craft facile prose; to play around with words

耍罈子.definition: to perform a jar juggling and balancing act

耍貧嘴.definition: (coll.) to wag one's tongue; to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes; to chatter endlessly; to speak glibly

耍賴.definition: to act shamelessly; to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc; to act dumb; to act as if sth never happened

耍鬧.definition: to skylark; to play boisterously; to fool around
